traffic.core

Class Phase

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • traffic.core.Phase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Phase
extends Observable
implements Serializable
    Class representing a phase at an intersection. Responsible for managing the states of each TrafficStream.
    Author:
    nic11
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructor and Description
      Phase()
      Constructor which will build a phase object with default property values.

      Constructor allowing name and description information to be supplied.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Phase

        public Phase()
        Constructor which will build a phase object with default property values.

      • Phase

        public Phase(String n,
             String d)
        Constructor allowing name and description information to be supplied. Newly created object will be in a red state.
        Parameters:
        n - Name for Phase
        d - Description for Phase.

    • Method Detail

      • addStream

        @Deprecated
public void addStream(TrafficStream s)
        Deprecated. Use addStream(stream, state) instead.
        Append a specified traffic stream to those already under the control of the phase. No detectors will be associated with the new stream.
        Parameters:
        s - a previously constructed TrafficStream object
        See Also:
        TrafficStream

      • addStream

        public void addStream(TrafficStream str,
                      State s)
        Append a specified traffic stream to those already under the control of the phase. When the phase is active, the stream will be in the specified state.
        Parameters:
        str - The stream
        s - The state

      • addStream

        public void addStream(TrafficStream str,
                      State s,
                      Detector d)
        Append a specified traffic stream to those already under the control of the phase and have it respond to the Detector provided. When the phase is active, the stream will be in the specified state.
        Parameters:
        str - The stream
        s - The state
        d - The stream's detector

      • getTrafficStreams

        public Collection<TrafficStream> getTrafficStreams()
        Tell others what traffic streams we are responsible for.
        Returns:
        TrafficStream objects.

      • streamCount

        public int streamCount()
        How many traffic streams we are currently responsible for.

      • setMinGreenInterval

        public void setMinGreenInterval(int secs)
        Set the minimum green interval. Phase should spend at least this long in the green state under any phase plan.

      • getMinGreenInterval

        public int getMinGreenInterval()
        Report the minimum green interval. Phase should spend at least this long in the green state under any phase plan.

      • start

        public void start()
        Performs activities needed to start a phase, possibly making use of other private methods. Notifies observers when started.
        See Also:
        Delay.pause(int)

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Performs activities needed to stop a phase and notifies observers
        See Also:
        Delay.pause(int)

      • needsService

        public boolean needsService()
        Reports whether or not this phase requires service. We require service if one or more of our traffic streams requires service. Notifies observers.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Use this to reset a phase which previously reported that it needed service. Will reset all associated traffic streams and their (optional) detectors.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Report name of this phase.

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription()
        Report the description of this phase.
        Returns:
        String containing description of Phase.

      • streamStates

        public Map<TrafficStream,State> streamStates()
        What does each stream do in this phase?
        Returns:
        map from TrafficStream to State

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Suitably formatted identification of this phase for use in log messages etc.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
